meanings.definition: To make more lively or energetic.
meanings.sent1: After a quick nap, the music started pepping up the party.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys pepping up her salads with fresh herbs.
meanings.sent3: The clown's antics were pepping up the children's mood.
meanings.sent4: The colorful decorations pepped up the dull room.
meanings.sent5: The energetic dance routine really pepped up the performance.

meanings.definition: To add zest or liveliness to.
meanings.sent1: The chef was pepping the soup with a hint of spice.
meanings.sent2: A squeeze of lemon can really pep up a glass of water.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes never fail to pep up the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude always manages to pep up the team.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the painting really pep up the room.
